website_summaries.verdict: The best budget set of mud flaps that will fit most larger vehicles like trucks and SUVs.
pros: Narrow design catches plenty of debris and mud to keep the vehicle clean
Comes with the necessary mounting hardware for most large vehicles
cons: Mud flaps tend to flex more due to the thin and flimsy construction

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Product tore off the truck after one trip down a dirt road. Now my camper has excessive damage. I do not recommend this product for anyone planning to use them for the intended purpose. If you plan to use them just for looks, might be the cheap product you need (if you dpnt lose them on the highway)
customer_reviews.author: cameron

customer_reviews.title: Good value for me.......
customer_reviews.text: Putting these on a custom truck so, I needed customizable mud flaps. They have a different design on each side.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pierson

customer_reviews.title: great mudflaps for RV
customer_reviews.text: Original set was purchased and installed 6 years ago. After those years of being on the road, full-timing in our RV, one of the originals started breaking at the mounting point. Found the exact replacement on Amazon, price was a bit higher than 6 years ago, but the new ones were a perfect match, and installed easily. Perhaps in another 6 years, we might have to replace them again.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rambow

customer_reviews.title: Very thin for the size of mud flap.
customer_reviews.text: For the size of this mud flap it is just too thin. I don't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Schmitz

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this purchase.....
customer_reviews.text: I sliced these flaps lengthwise to make an upper snow flap on my Polaris Ranger plow. Has worked extremely well for that purpose and was a lot cheaper than buying a full length version selling for 3 times as much.
customer_reviews.author: K. A. S.

customer_reviews.title: Light duty at best
customer_reviews.text: These are extremely light duty. There built for a single wheel only. I had to buy a diffrent set that is actually heavy duty and designed for trucks. There 18" long 12" wide and 1\8" thick. They would be fine on a small 3\4 ton or smaller truck. But suck at any thing that is off road. There really flexible and sail in the air easily.
customer_reviews.author: David Glenn

customer_reviews.title: 4 small mud flaps.
customer_reviews.text: These were 4 pieces not 2 large mud flaps. Ripped when I took them apart because of the huge staples they put in them.
customer_reviews.author: Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Nice!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are real good quality flaps. I have them on my Jeep
customer_reviews.author: TOP DOG

customer_reviews.title: RV license plate flap
customer_reviews.text: Perfect width and thickness for license plate on back of RV. Can move both ways if plate would scape going through a ravine. Saves bent/ripped plates.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M

customer_reviews.title: Good price, but pretty thin
customer_reviews.text: Good price, but pretty thin. The staples in the packaging ripped through the flaps. Doesn't seem to really hurt them. I did have two of the bolts that were holding them on rip through, I would drill my own holes rather than use the slots next time.
customer_reviews.author: Java230

customer_reviews.title: Good resolution.
customer_reviews.text: We actually attached these to the mud flaps that came on the truck. Light weight, does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Imelda H.

customer_reviews.title: so I purchased these and they worked fine. Heavy duty and pliable enough for task
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get a hold of old mud flaps to cut up for my snow blower impellor mod, so I purchased these and they worked fine. Heavy duty and pliable enough for task.
customer_reviews.author: The CB Hammer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Got a pair for just the back tires on my Chevy C10, they were plenty wide for my All-terrains and felt pretty tough. Liked em so much I also ordered some for the front tires.
customer_reviews.author: HolyCrapps

customer_reviews.title: Used these behind my duel axle trailer tires and they ...
customer_reviews.text: Used these behind my duel axle trailer tires and they seem to be holding up well and doing their job .
customer_reviews.author: ak2012

customer_reviews.title: They are just O K
customer_reviews.text: First trip out, I noticed that they "flew up" when traveling at highway speed. A bolted a 1/8in. X 1in. strip to the bottom. This helped to keep them from blowing in the breeze. The second trip the right side tore loose. They are just a little thin and flimsy. I'm going with regular TRUCK mudflaps next.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Slusser

customer_reviews.title: 2006 GMC W3500 Turbo Diesel Box Truck
customer_reviews.text: Used this for cheap solution for the front mud flaps in our box truck. It does not go all the way across but it protects the important stuff, like the battery and such. Needed to cut about 4 inches off but it was not difficult and was easily cut with heavy duty scissors. Great price. We did not need the hardware but just as a clarification their version of mounting hardware is just 6 wide head black screws. Depending on what vehicle you use it on you will need more than that. Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: jb

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Seem to be good quality. They were easy to trim with a speed square and a razor knife.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I've put on a lot of mud flaps being a truck driver and these won't hold up. They tear to easily at the mounting slots at the top of the flaps.. They are not heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: S. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: 👍👍👍
customer_reviews.text: These tore way too easily after 1000 mile trip on road.
customer_reviews.author: David J Martin

customer_reviews.title: These heavy duty rubber mud flaps worked great on my freinds RV the order was on time ...
customer_reviews.text: These heavy duty rubber mud flaps worked great on my freinds RV the order was on time I am going to order some for my RV
customer_reviews.author: Clyde Cockerham

customer_reviews.title: Good for the cost
customer_reviews.text: Good product, thick, and durable..worth the money, I gave it 4 stars only because theirs no drilled slots or holes. But that's an easy fix
customer_reviews.author: GREG

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: I cut these to fit my 99 suburban and they worked great.
customer_reviews.author: d stegman

customer_reviews.title: Great for extending an existing mud flap
customer_reviews.text: I mounted these horizontally across the bottom of my existing dually mud flap to extend the reach toward the ground. A very simple solution!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: bought them .. but they had huge staples thru the middle of the mudflap that made unsighly holes in them ..poorly packaged
customer_reviews.text: bought them .. but they had huge staples thru the middle of the mudflap that made unsighly holes in them ..poorly packaged i thought i was getting fresh new mudflaps not ones with 5 holes thru them
customer_reviews.author: justin

customer_reviews.title: Arrived on time, looked like what they were, worked!
customer_reviews.text: The hardware that came was useless, we riveted the mud flaps to the camper wheel wells.
customer_reviews.author: Muriel Doleman

customer_reviews.title: Ok but need hardware.
customer_reviews.text: They seem adequate for the price. My only disappointment was that "all hardware included" means they come with 6 screws. I was hoping for some sort of bracket but I'm sure I can improvise something.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: I use this on mi tacoma 05, in a ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this on mi tacoma 05, in a week end trip with much mud.. the 4 screws and washer per side, was the only thing that was left.. would not buy it again...
customer_reviews.author: Cliente Kindle

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I put these on my RV and they look great. They are just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I made to fit on fifth wheel camper- keeps back of camper behind wheels a lot cleaner
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: I got em and there perfect
customer_reviews.text: Nice mud flaps for the price ended up getting 4, for my 77 power wagon
customer_reviews.author: PJSTAFFY

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for what I used them for. Strong and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: Little wide for my Saturn. Will have to cut them down a bit. Heavy rubber material. Feels high quality!
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: a good buy!
customer_reviews.text: They hold up well, I have been off roading with them and no issues
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Mostly Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I hate to trash a product, but I have to be honest. I have had these less than a year, all are cracking, one has dried up and fallen off. Go another direction, unless desperate.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Used them for my trailer and they work great! Really heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Easily modifible
customer_reviews.text: Used them on a trailer from Harbor Freight. Easily modifiable and held up to a lot of abuse.
customer_reviews.author: The Doughboy

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Great basic mud flap...heavy duty and does the job for about $50 LESS than could pick up similar locally!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rubber soft
customer_reviews.text: Product looked good installed by direction. Rubber soft and lost one the first week
customer_reviews.author: Wino

customer_reviews.title: Mud flaps for Camper
customer_reviews.text: These are quality rubber mud flaps , the should have no trouble lasting as long as the camper they are installed on ,very easy to install, great product .
customer_reviews.author: Big-Red

customer_reviews.title: Good heavy duty flaps.
customer_reviews.text: Used these to make permanent mud flaps to protect boat and trailer from flying rocks. Heavy duty but still added a weight bar for anti-sail.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are small, I guess I didn't read the description very well.
customer_reviews.author: mike T

customer_reviews.title: Highland Splash Guards
customer_reviews.text: The Highland Splash Guards will work but they are not heavy duty. I have a splash guard (same size) from previous years in my garage and the new Highland Splash Guards are not heavy duty. The old one is over 1/4" thick and very flexible rubber and fibers. The Highland Splash Guards are a lot thinner and not as flexible. I think they will work ok on my RV trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Trainman

customer_reviews.title: Great Flaps!
customer_reviews.text: These were just what i was looking for, at a grwat price. Looks like they should hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: WhtShadow

customer_reviews.title: Great Flaps at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: They're mud flaps. Used different install hardware. Easily trimmed for custom installations.
customer_reviews.author: S. L.

customer_reviews.title: mud flap
customer_reviews.text: The screws that came with it were small. I ended up getting bigger boltsfor mounting. The mud flap itself was good
customer_reviews.author: clay madrona

customer_reviews.title: Thin less than .25" and suspect for long duty
customer_reviews.text: It's an ok light duty mud flap for generic install but not up to HD service on my ranch.
customer_reviews.author: One Ranger

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Riveted these to my existing flaps as an extension to my lifted jeep cj
customer_reviews.author: terry eichhorst

customer_reviews.title: mud flaps are perfect for the money
customer_reviews.text: These flaps were perfect for my jeep, couldn't find anything that size and quality for the money. No complaints. I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Chris LaValley

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: very good product very good product it is what is. what more can a person want? So get it and be happy, happy, happy.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Otology

customer_reviews.title: which appears to be what offroad innovations bases their kit on in the first place so fit was perfect. I actually replaced both
customer_reviews.text: I have a set of offroad innovations trailflaps on on my jeep jk. One mud flap got ripped off on the trail so I purchased this set, which appears to be what offroad innovations bases their kit on in the first place so fit was perfect. I actually replaced both flaps with the new ones so they would match and kept the remaining original used one as a spare until I ripped a second one off. Well that just happened and luckily I had the spare flap hanging around, already dirt-matched to the one on the jeep.
customer_reviews.author: Kiahuna Griller

customer_reviews.title: Staples through the rubber required a needle nose plier to remove
customer_reviews.text: Other than that they do what they are designed to do... Great mud flap. These are pretty big so make sure you are not overdoing it by measuring your tire for comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: I installed these on my off-road rig for road use ...
customer_reviews.text: I installed these on my off-road rig for road use. They worked well for about 3 months until they tore off on the highway.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel May

customer_reviews.title: All is good with this Seller
customer_reviews.text: As Expected, as Promised, All is good with this Seller!
customer_reviews.author: Rick Musgrave

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: I installed them on the back of my utility bed. They work well and are of a very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with these
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with these. I was not able to find them at any of the local auto parts stores.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Bennett

customer_reviews.title: I like them.
customer_reviews.text: I put these on my travel trailer. I like them.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Collier

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great for the buck on my f350 plow truck with home made wheel wells
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love them and they look good on my truck. Price is great too.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality - Not Durable .
customer_reviews.text: The mats lasted only seven months of light truck use (less than 1,000 miles driven). Cool winter temps made the "heavy rubber" brittle and they detached during normal city/highway driving. The mats cracked and broke off at the top - adjacent to the bolt attachments. Bolts were snug but not over tightened when installed. I am disappointed and would NOT recommend this product to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Wildland Fire Fighter

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, little thin with the rubber on top had to make another bracket to stabilize the flap
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Tumminelli

customer_reviews.title: Mud flaps
customer_reviews.text: This was the only mud flap that I could find that was straight across the top and not curved. I also did not want a design on it. They shipped it perfect time and is a great mud flap.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Damron

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect length and width for my needs. They need a bit of stiffening to keep from 'floating' at high speeds but other than that work great.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Fralick

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a big floppy mud flap to go on my volvo c30 and that's exactly what I got, they were big at first but I just cut them with a pair of scissors and now my volvo looks like a rally car :)
customer_reviews.author: dawson maddox

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Consruction
customer_reviews.text: Rubber mounting points on both guard riped within a matter of weeks (during which time I barely even used the vehicle) and required me to clamp them back to the hanger using large washers each size. this are by no means a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Saxon

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Actually ordered these splash guards to use as a protective barrier under my RV tires. Very please with sturdy construction.
customer_reviews.author: leene2

customer_reviews.title: Trailer Mud Guards
customer_reviews.text: I bought the mud guards for a utility trailer. I've driven 1800 miles, so far and they have worked perfectly. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Edward A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: decent
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to defeat a fix it ticket and the material ripped when I installed them because the screw went in too far. Mud flaps are lame anyway but it got me past my fixit ticket.
customer_reviews.author: matthew sheridan

product_meta.title: Highland 1007300 Black Heavy Duty Rubber Splash Guard - 2 Piece
product_meta.description: Highland Black Heavy Duty Rubber Splash Guards are designed to prevent mud and small rocks from being thrown up against the body of the vehicle or from being thrown at a following vehicle. They are made from heavy duty rubber for maximum style and protection. These splash guards include mounting hardware for easy installation and are backed by limited lifetime warranty.
feature_bullets: Made from heavy duty rubber for maximum style and protection
Measures 18 inch long and 12 inch wide
Includes mounting hardware for easy installation
Fits vans, minivans, pickups, light trucks, RVs and SUVs

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars242 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
